page.title: 09Famous person
page.content: {Sir Henry Newbolt}1862-l938 He wrote many poems during the early years of this century and is buried at Orchardleigh, ner Frome. Two of his most famous are 'Drake's Drum' and 'Vita Lampada' ("There's a breathless hush in the close tonight"). Another of his poems tells of the illegal burial of a dog with his master in Orchardleigh churchyard. Newbolt married Margaret Duckworth of Orchardleigh and their two plain grave slabs can be found in the little churchyard at the edge of the lake below Orchardleigh House. by Robert Connolly (11)
